items.text: I often feel like I am the most important person in the room.
items.rationale: A sense of superiority and self-importance is a hallmark of Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: People often tell me that I have a commanding presence.
items.rationale: Commanding presence is associated with the assertiveness and dominance of Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I enjoy being the center of attention at social gatherings.
items.rationale: Seeking attention is a key characteristic of Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I believe I am destined for greatness.
items.rationale: Belief in one's own exceptional destiny is typical of Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I often take charge in group situations because I know I can lead well.
items.rationale: Taking charge and believing in one's leadership abilities are traits of Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I am not afraid to assert my opinions, even if they are unpopular.
items.rationale: Assertiveness and confidence in one's opinions are linked to Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I often fantasize about achieving great success and recognition.
items.rationale: Fantasies of success and recognition are common in Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I feel that I deserve special treatment.
items.rationale: A sense of entitlement is a core feature of Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I am confident that I can achieve anything I set my mind to.
items.rationale: Overconfidence in one's abilities is characteristic of Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I often feel that others are envious of my achievements.
items.rationale: Believing others are envious is a sign of Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I enjoy talking about my accomplishments.
items.rationale: Talking about one's accomplishments is typical of Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I am often the leader in group projects.
items.rationale: Leadership roles are often sought by those with Grandiose Narcissism.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I need to prove my worth to others.
items.rationale: While this can indicate a need for validation, it may also reflect underlying insecurity.

items.text: I like to be admired by others.
items.rationale: Desire for admiration is linked to Grandiose Narcissism but can also relate to general social approval.

items.text: I sometimes feel anxious about not living up to my own high standards.
items.rationale: This could reflect perfectionism (Conscientiousness) or a fear of inadequacy (Vulnerable Narcissism).

items.text: I often feel like people are out to get me.
items.rationale: Paranoia and suspicion are common in Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I frequently worry about being rejected by others.
items.rationale: Fear of rejection is a key feature of Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I often feel ashamed of my weaknesses.
items.rationale: Shame and sensitivity to perceived flaws are central to Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I am not good enough.
items.rationale: Feelings of inadequacy are typical of Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I often feel anxious in social situations.
items.rationale: Social anxiety is a common trait in Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I am sensitive to criticism from others.
items.rationale: Sensitivity to criticism is a hallmark of Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I often feel like I am misunderstood by others.
items.rationale: Feeling misunderstood is common in Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I sometimes feel overwhelmed by my emotions.
items.rationale: Emotional overwhelm is a characteristic of Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I often feel like I am not appreciated enough.
items.rationale: Feeling underappreciated is linked to Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I am a burden to others.
items.rationale: Feeling like a burden is a sign of Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I often feel like I need reassurance from others.
items.rationale: Seeking reassurance is common in Vulnerable Narcissism.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I am too sensitive.
items.rationale: While sensitivity is a trait of Vulnerable Narcissism, it can also relate to general emotionality.

items.text: I often feel like I am not living up to my potential.
items.rationale: This can indicate self-doubt, a feature of Vulnerable Narcissism, but also relates to personal growth concerns.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I need to hide my true self from others.
items.rationale: This could reflect social anxiety (Neuroticism) or a fear of vulnerability (Vulnerable Narcissism).
